intro: Tricalysia bagshawei subsp. malaissei, commonly known as the Malaisian tricalysia, is a flowering plant native to Southeast Asia. It belongs to the Rubiaceae family, which includes coffee and gardenias. The plant is characterized by its simple, opposite leaves and clusters of small, white to pale yellow flowers. It typically grows as an understory shrub in tropical rainforests. Due to its limited distribution and habitat specificity, it is considered a rare and endangered species.
